The Chapter with SihÄsani
The Elder Pilindavacchaâ€™s Birth Story
When the Lord of the World,
the foremost person Sumedha, had passed away;
With a confident and joyful mind,
I made a shrine-offering.
Those who were free from defilements there,
with the six deep knowledges and great power;
I brought them all together there,
and made a meal for the Sangha.
The Fortunate One Sumedha
was the attendant at that time;
His name was Sumedha,
and he rejoiced then.
By that confidence in my mind,
I was reborn in a divine palace;
Eighty-six thousand
sugar-cane stalks delighted me.
They all followed me,
and always had all the sensual pleasures;
I surpassed the other gods,
this is the fruit of my meritorious deeds.
In the twenty-fifth (Buddha) era,
a noble one named Varuna;
I was a pure feeder,
a Wheel-turning Monarch at that time.
They did not plough the seed,
